title: Consuming a simple ONNX model for text classification from ML.Net
body:
I'm trying to consume a trained scikit learn model that was converted to ONNX from ML.Net but I'm not sure if this is actually an issue with ML.Net, sklearn-onnx or my model. Attempting to load the onnx model in ML.Net results in the following error:

> System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: 'dim (Parameter 'Dimension { } in ONNX tensor cannot exceed the maximum of 32-bit signed integer.')
> Actual value was 0.'
> 

Inspecting the generated model in Netron made me curious whether the error might be triggered by both outputs having a zero length?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51688/65391096-6fe19180-dd65-11e9-965a-3eab334533a6.png)

**Model creation in python:**

```python
import os
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import TfidfVectorizer
from sklearn.svm import LinearSVC
from skl2onnx import convert_sklearn
from skl2onnx.common.data_types import StringTensorType
import pandas as pd
from onnxmltools import save_model

data = pd.read_csv('training_data.csv', sep='\t')

pipeline = Pipeline([
  ('tfidf', TfidfVectorizer()),
  ('clf', LinearSVC()),
])

pipeline.fit(data["Keywords"], data["Label"])

onnx = convert_sklearn(pipeline, name='test_predictor',
  initial_types=[('input', StringTensorType([1, 1]))])

save_model(onnx, "test.onnx")
```
